data.title: Contact Bristol City Council
data.meta_description: How you can contact Bristol City Council by online form, email or phone.
data.text:
How you can contact us to get the services you need by online form, email or phone.

For Deaf people only

Contact us using BSL interpreter or by using Textphone, Texmee, or Relay UK Service.

Sign Video BSL interpreting: Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm, you'll need a computer or laptop with a webcam, tablet or smartphone and a broadband connection or a 3G/4G data plan on your mobile device

Textphone 0208 964 6345

Smart phone app: Texmee, available on the app store

RelayUK app for your smartphone or computer

From 31 March 2024 the Textphone, Texbox and Texmee service will be replaced by the Relay UK service. Further infomation on the Relay UK service can be found at Relay UK.

Adult care social services (Care Direct)

Help and advice with adult care, report abuse of vulnerable adults.

Adult care and health - online services

Call 0117 922 2700

Bins, recycling and street maintenance

Recycling and bin collections, maintenance of roads and pavements, street lighting, graffiti and fly-tipping, street litter.

Bins and recycling - online services

Street cleaning - online services

Roads, pavements and drains - online services

Call 0117 922 2100

Email waste.services@bristol.gov.uk

Phone lines open Monday to Friday 8.30am to 6pm. Closed Wednesday 12pm to 1.30pm.

Business rates

Make a payment, apply for small business rates relief or charitable relief, moving property, advice and enquiries.

Business rates - online services

Apply for a blue badge or disabled parking bay, travelcard enquiries.

Bus passes - concessionary travel

Disabled parking - blue badges

Children and families services

Help and advice with childen and families, report any concerns about a child or young person.

Children and families - online services

Call 0117 903 6444

Citizen Service Point

Pay your rent, tenancy enquiries, anti-social behaviour, repairs, caretaking.

Report a repair

Pay your rent

Council tax

Pay your bill, apply for council tax benefit, single adult discount, disabled band relief, moving house, advice and enquiries.

Council tax online services

Council tax general enquiry form - use this form to make general enquiries about council tax, give us information about your account or attach a document.

Electoral services

By post: Electoral Services, Bristol City Council, B Bond Warehouse (5th Floor), Smeaton Road, Bristol, BS1 6XN

In person: CYPS Reception, B Bond, Smeaton Road, Bristol, BS1 6XN

Our office hours are 9am to 4.30pm, Monday to Thursday and 9am to 4pm, Friday.

Find out how we can help you if you're homeless or think you might be homeless in the future.

Call 0117 352 6800

Email: HomelessnessAdvice@bristol.gov.uk

Phone lines open Monday to Friday 8.30am to 6pm. Closed Wednesday 12pm to 1.30pm.

Housing benefit contact form

Call 0117 922 2300

Our jobs site

Help to view job information or applying for a job.

Email hr.advicecentre@bristol.gov.uk

Call 0117 352 1400 between 10am and 2pm, Monday to Friday

Please only use this number for enquiries about jobs. For all other issues use the service numbers on this page or call the switchboard on 0117 922 2000.

For legal services queries, email legal.support@bristol.gov.uk
